label: A4BC2_oP28_56_cde_a_e-001
title: Low-temperature Sr$_{2}$SnO$_{4}$ Structure
comments:
We use the 4K data from (Fu, 2002). 
 Many sources, including the ICSD, use La$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$ as the prototype for this structure, however (Yamada, 1988) find that that compound is better described as being in the La$_{2}$NiO$_{4}$ structure. 
 All of these structures are distortions of the \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C_tI14_139_ce_e_a-001}{K$_{2}$NiF$_{4}$ Ruddlesden-Popper structure}, a tetragonal perovskite phase. 
 (Yun, 2022) describe the phase transitions of Sr$_{2}$SnO$_{4}$ with temperature: \begin{itemize} \item At 4K it is in this \href{current_web_home_dir/A4BC2_oP28_56_cde_a_e-001}{low-temperature Sr$_{2}$SnO$_{4}$}, however note that (Fu, 2002) give crystallographic information for this structure up to 300K. \item At 12K it is observed in the aforementioned \href{current_web_home_dir/A2BC4_oP28_50_gh_ac_ghm-001}{La$_{2}$NiO$_{4}$ structure}. \item At 295K it is found in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_oC28_64_a_f_ef-003}{orthorhombic La$_{2}$CuO$_{4}$ structure}, and 
 finally, at 593K, it is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C_tI14_139_ce_e_a-001}{K$_{2}$NiF$_{4}$ Ruddlesden-Popper structure}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-0.25in} 
 The exact experimental situation for these Ruddlesden-Popper derivatives is very uncertain, and we will update this page if and when more information is available.
